The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: The sequel everyone has been waiting for\, end up being the sequel no one wanted.That's how I feel\, I did not expect this story to be told. Why? mostly because a whole game based on the \"cycle of violence/revenge/forgiveness\" (and not going at it the right way) and not focusing on the zombies\, cure\, or a better world building\, well kinda a miss for me. But still very good and a rare experience.What's my problems with this sequel? The characters mostly. Abby (/Owen). I don't hate her. I get what was the point of her story\, why we played her. I do\, but\, it just doesn't work for me.Could be because\, we play her after 15 HOURS\, you know when we are very invested in Ellie (can't be compared with how we get play Ellie in the first game). Maybe because we play her after a big cliffhanger\, and get back to it after hours. Maybe because we see her kill and torture XXX. Or maybe because her and Owen story felt bland\, boring\, long? I get it\, we need to sympathize with them. But not like this (I did like Abby with Lev and Yara\, it was interesting).And we spend quite a few hours playing Abby\, when other characters get almost nothing. Dina\, Tommy\, Jesse and Maria.Ellie loses everything\, even herself (PTSD\, not explored or talked about) for revenge. In this game the characters don't talk a lot about their feelings or what happened\, it's missing\, we have visuals but... Even worse\, if you miss an entry in the journal\, you might not understand correctly Ellie.That being said\, it's still an amazing experience. The gameplay is really good when given the opportunity. The graphics are a big step up\, for me\, it's the character animations that I liked the most. Again story not perfect for a few things\, but for the rest it was good. The flashbacks could have been handled better\, sometimes it was frustrating\, more so with Abby. And lots of options to play how you want in the settings.… Expand
